it's just something so that your fondant

I've got a bit of cornflour I've got two

I've got some little white pearl

you'll also need a batch of our sugar

greaseproof paper and a cooling rack so
let's get started now the first thing
you want to do when your cookie dough
comes out of the fridge you just want to
knead it so that it's nice and pliable
and then you want to sprinkle down a
good amount of that plain flour and
we're just going to roll out the cookie
dough make sure you have plenty of flour
both on the top and the bottom you want
to roll it out and keep the cookie dough
moving so that it doesn't stick to your
surface but you're basically looking for
an even thickness of about this thick
take your princess crown cutter and cut
out several of those Crown shapes so
you'll notice I sort of jiggle the
cutter back and forward that's to give

lay those all out on your grease proof
paper or your baking paper on that
cookie tray if they're going to go off
into the oven and they're going to cook
really
about seven to ten minutes you'll know
they're done when the edges are slightly
golden brown so very carefully use your
offset spatula or a knife just to
carefully pick them up and pop them onto
that cooling rack and you don't want to
try to work with these until they have
completely cooled sprinkle down a little
bit of your cornflour and just press out
your pink fondant or modeling chocolate
and then you want to roll that out using
your fondant roller tool it's really
really nice and thin your princess
cookie cutter is going to be used once

shaking it back and forward for that
really nice even cut around the edges
using your paintbrush you just want to
spread the entire outside of your cookie

with your lemon curd or your jam
whatever the sticky substance is that
you're using once you've got a really
nice coating pick up one of your little
princess crowns and it should be pretty
much exactly the same size as the cookie
because the recipe I give you doesn't
allow for any shrinkage or any
stretching so you just want to use your
fingers now to go right the way around
the edges flatten down your fondant onto

you're kind of just molding that fondant
in so that it's meeting up absolutely

I've never had a problem with it it

a small love heart sprinkle on either
